security_audit.summary: Only a single documentation file is present. No executable code, network calls, or filesystem access patterns are defined. No indicators of data theft or malicious execution were found.

content.user_title: Build cross-browser extensions with WXT guidance
content.value_statement: Browser extension projects often struggle with cross-browser details and i18n structure. This skill guides WXT-based workflows and directory conventions for Chrome, Firefox, and Edge.
actual_capabilities: Targets Chrome, Firefox, and Edge extension workflows
Covers WXT configuration and Manifest V3 structure
Highlights entrypoints for background and content scripts
Documents i18n locale folder layout and required keys
Provides npm commands for dev, build, lint, and test
limitations: Only applies to projects using the browser/ directory layout
Assumes the WXT framework and its build pipeline
Does not create store listings or release artifacts

use_cases.title: Cross-browser setup
use_cases.description: Set up Chrome, Firefox, and Edge workflows with clear entrypoint and config guidance.

use_cases.title: Add new locale
use_cases.description: Create new i18n message files with required keys and consistent structure.

use_cases.title: Standardize workflow
use_cases.description: Align the team on dev, build, lint, and test commands for the extension.

prompt_templates.title: Get started
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the browser/ extension structure and where background and content scripts live.

prompt_templates.title: Add a locale
prompt_templates.prompt: List the steps and required keys to add a new i18n locale in public/_locales.

prompt_templates.title: Build guidance
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe which npm commands build for Chrome and Firefox and what outputs to expect.

prompt_templates.title: Cross-browser check
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my plan for Chrome, Firefox, and Edge compatibility and note any WXT-specific concerns.

output_examples.input: Summarize the key extension entrypoints and where to update i18n.
output: Background and content scripts are in browser/entrypoints.
Locales live under browser/public/_locales per language.
Messages must include appDescription and openWithRepomix.

best_practices: Keep entrypoint responsibilities separate for background and content scripts
Update i18n message keys consistently across all locales
Run lint and tests before completing changes
anti_patterns: Mixing Chrome and Firefox API usage without checks
Adding locales without required message keys

faq.question: Which browsers does this skill cover?
faq.answer: It targets Chrome, Firefox, and Edge using WXT and Manifest V3 guidance.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It focuses on the browser/ directory and WXT structure, not store submission or packaging.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with an existing repo?
faq.answer: Yes, if the repo uses a WXT-based browser/ layout with similar entrypoints.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No, it provides documentation guidance and does not access files or network data.

faq.question: What if dev or build commands fail?
faq.answer: Check npm scripts, WXT config, and dependency installation in your project.

faq.question: How does it compare to general extension guides?
faq.answer: It is focused on this specific WXT layout and i18n conventions rather than generic advice.
